The Forsakens employed a design logic for Epitaph that diverged entirely from that of the Science Council. The demands placed on the user to control the power output are exceedingly stringent, carrying the perilous possibility of frame self-destruction if mishandled. However, Watanabe, who adeptly maneuvered the frame with ease upon its initial activation, dismisses any concerns. To him, the rigors of the battlefield provide a far more brutal test.

Though Epitaph's creation may have arisen from malice, Watanabe has long transcended that darkness. He has traversed the river of death, retracing his steps to the summit of purgatory, all to honor the promise he made from the very start—no matter what adversity he encounters, he will always return and always fight for what he believes in.
Nothing related to Punishing can be detected on the new frame, Shukra. Qu is no longer regarded as a Transcendant by Babylonia as well.

Compared to the damaged Pavo frame, the Shukra frame reborn in despair has a stronger external structure and a stable output power, allowing it to pull through high-intensity combats over a long period of time.

Shukra's core driving force derives from an unknown energy technology with no previous design samples. Qu doesn't care about its mysterious existence on her new reforged frame. She accepts everything Shukra has given her.
Through Shukra, Qu is able to touch and observe the deceased lives. She looks back on the past with the will of the living and cherishes the power that didn't come easy.

The new frame has an appearance that's entirely different from Pavo. The simple and elegant color scheme highlights Qu's rationality and authority. Inside the seemingly fragile body is a heavily burdened soul.
Shukra is inspired by the morning star that appears on the horizon, which symbolizes the farewell to the dark night and foretells the arrival of dawn.

To withstand harsh battle conditions, the frame features a reinforced skeletal structure and durable composite materials. Additionally, a new energy source has been integrated to enhance its endurance.

The frame enables two-way connectivity with Teddy's headphones and micro-terminal, facilitating seamless offense and defense in combat without distractions, which significantly reduces system-level logical errors.

Teddy personally picked a color scheme to reflect her style for the frame's appearance design. As this scheme isn't ideal for outdoor concealment, she intentionally coated it with a new stealth paint for camouflage.

The frame's communication device is tailored to top-tier specifications, utilizing a dedicated satellite relay and equipped with anti-jamming modules. These enhancements leave nothing to chance in the face of electronic warfare.
While Teddy's frame has garnered praise from her colleagues, she feels a slight sense of offense when complimented on its cuteness, as this deviates from her original design intent.
As a technician, Teddy dislikes engaging in combat but never shirks from it, willingly stepping onto the front lines when she deems it necessary.
The frame has some of the traits of the Red Tide. Without restraint, it will devour anything it touches by instinct.

The Oblivion frame is made of Punishing Virus that is as concentrated as a branch of Red Tide branch on a daily basis. The frame's operation does not follow conventional theory, so technically it doesn't have a structure. Luna can change everything from the overall frame to the internal structure according to her wishes.

Luna has mastered more ways of using the Punishing Virus. In addition to the most basic ones—making physical weapons and unleashing electromagnetic energy, she's now capable of deconstructing and reconstructing matters like the Red Tide, analyzing and restoring data like the Phantom Tracer, and so on. She still hasn't managed or used more advanced applications of the virus due to the limits of her level of stability.

The Oblivion frame doesn't have something like a core, so it can't be paralyzed by destroying its joints or breaking its trunk. Based on Luna's performance, the only way to defeat this frame is to reduce the Punishing Virus in it through attacks to under a certain level.

Ever since Luna kept the Ascension-Network in her body, the data fragments of the dead carried by the Punishing Virus and the malicious data woven in the Ascension-Network have been corrupting her consciousness. This is the price of her power and the path she resolutely chose.

According to the Ascension-Network's simulation, Luna will become a beacon on the path to the doomsday, but the existence of the Oblivion frame has crushed this definition. No one can decide Luna's future. She's no longer the Ascension-Network's puppet. This is her first step to the future, but it will never be the last.
BPO-42, frame name Ardeo, Tank, developed under the leadership of the Science Council for the exploration mission in Konstantin with specially enhanced ignition system.

The Ardeo frame's parameters are actually not exceptional. The frame has shown average output power in a series of tests. As for why Bridget can always bring an outstanding performance out of the frame, the Science Council's answer is "that should be the user."

"Tactical Tonfas" is the full name of Bridget's weapon. It can expand into an energy shield and is suitable for both attack and defense, making it a perfect weapon for the Support Force. The design happens to meet the Science Council's original idea of creating a frame capable of both tearing down old structures and preventing mine collapses.

Bridget is qualified to join the Elite Squad under the Task Force both in terms of experience and abilities. However, she believes that everyone has a position that suits themselves, and the Support Force is a better place for her to help everyone and shine.
The thrusters installed in the frame's feet can extremely boost Bridget's mobility in an instant, which buys her precious time when she's on rescue missions on the frontline.

Bridget has been fighting in pursuit of truth for many years and has unconsciously become a beacon for others as well. Now, with countless people following her example, she is not alone on this long road anymore.
After Hanying was injured by "The Emperor" in Kowloong and due to the difficulty of replacing damaged parts, she switched to a new frame with optimized signal pathways for better crisis response.

The new frame's "Cocoon" pod captures the user's brainwaves and shapes their appearance based on their thoughts. In other words, the appearance of the Solacetune frame is formed according to Hanying's own ideas.
The frame, influenced by Hanying's dancer mindset, features elegant yet deceptive combat moves inspired by Kowloong dances.
Compared to traditional cold weapons, the hairpin, one of her weapons, is shorter but perfectly complements Solacetune's high mobility due to its lightweight and portability.
She can synchronize with the "dreams" of other mechanoids to a certain extent and recreate this audiovisual experience.
With highly flexible fingers and precise rhythm control, she excels in music games despite being somewhat clumsy in most other games.

Even when Wanshi goes into hibernation, he remains vigilant and alert, like a beast that has to survive in the jungle. He never exposes his weaknesses in unfamiliar environments or in front of strangers. However, rumor has it that he can fall into deep sleep like a child in the presence of the Commandant of Gray Raven.

The frame's new hairstyle seems to draw inspiration from a Kowloong legend about protecting children's health. "'The immortal touched my head and taught me the secrets of longevity.' They say that's the origin of the Longevity Braid. I don't care much about living long. I'll just live for the lives I've witnessed and carry their wishes as I go."

Wanshi has always despised lies. In the past, the most he would compromise was keeping silent when he had no other choice. But now, he is willing to try to make a change, to uphold the balance between truth and happiness.

Sometimes, Wanshi can have trouble opening up to others. During a volunteer session at the pediatric department of the Star of Life, a few children patients shared their thoughts about "Doctor Wanshi". When a boy described him as "very nice", Wanshi simply patted the boy's head without speaking.

Wanshi's laid-back personality often gives others the impression that he doesn't care about anything. In truth, he has an extraordinary dedication to the people and things he holds dear. "Have you heard of the torch relays from the Golden Age? They carry a torch and march against the wind. They never give up, even if the flames burn them along the way."

Driven by the compassionate nature of a healer, Wanshi vividly remembers every life that crossed his path but eventually faded away. Comrades, patients, strangers - the weight of those lives is quietly carried in his heart, never forgotten. The path he walks no longer belongs to him alone. "I will lend them my eyes, so they can see this world rise from the ashes."

Some details of Pyroath's appearance are the mutual work of Lucia and Gray Raven members. The design of the machine spine on the back has accepted Lee's advice. The wings on the sides were painted by Liv. The blonde highlights on the front are of the color that Lucia always wanted to try.

The platinum color signifies the longing for the light. A concealing paint was applied on the surface so that the bright color wouldn't expose Lucia in combat, allowing her to become invisible when necessary. The frame is also equipped with four laser drones for better efficiency during stealth combats.

Fire would accidentally come out from the seams when Lucia started to get used to the frame, which wouldn't hurt Constructs but would harm humans. Therefore, Lucia practiced alone for a long time until she managed to control the flames with precision.

Lucia depends more on the familiar peripheral devices like Plume's thrusters than unfamiliar components. Therefore, the Science Council has loaded relevant data of "Feather" in the maneuvering propellers and Corvus's behavioral model.
Pyroath has a relatively high constant temperature. In cold environments, Lucia would approach the Commandant to provide warmth just in time.

Pyroath, the name of the frame, means the fire carrying the oath of guarding everyone during the long night. No matter how long the night would last, Lucia will fight to the end, because this is where her most important dreams and people are.

Fulgor is an Attacker frame especially created to enhance Scarab's adaptability to complex battlefields. When the Science Council asked Yata if she had any suggestions for frame modifications, she responded, "I don't care. As long as it doesn't hinder my fighting."
Yata's powered arms were created based on robotic arms. They have gone through material and structure upgrades for better portability and attack ability after Yata changed her frame.
With her old life ruined by the disaster caused by Punishing Virus, Yata tends to remain quiet about things related to the Hydrangea Island, refusing to think about her old days on campus.

Yata still exercises even after the Construct surgery. According to herself, "I feel calm when breathing heavily." She works out to maintain peak combat readiness at all times. This habit has made Scarab a regular winner of the "Babylonia Emergency Operation Role Model" award.
Fulgor's armature can be connected to the powered arms' load backpack to form different shapes with electricity. The baseball bat is Yata's favorite.

Shorthalt once told Yata, "Bullets are not fired to burn themselves, but they have to get ready for it in order to hit the target." It wasn't until Shorthalt passed away and Yata became the new captain that she truly understood the meaning of these words—to protect things she cherishes, she has to be the bullet that bravely comes out of the barrel and lights up the sky before the darkness falls.

The foot thrusters, model IR-101, are a supercharged upgrade of Pulse's original thrusters, IR-005. Fed with ecological data from countless planets, they can perfectly adapt to a variety of planetary environments, including Earth.
The new frame has significantly improved color sensitivity. Zavier also added a virtual projection board, so Nanami can doodle freely even in a vacuum.

The magnetic levitation engine in the back is also designed for outer space. In a vacuum, it will replace the thrusters to generate massive thrust, and it can also work with the thrusters to drive the frame in non-vacuum environments.

Influenced by Nanami, Power has gradually developed its own will and embarked on its growth journey. Although it doesn't follow Nanami around like before after the frame upgrade, they still maintain a telepathic connection. When Nanami needs it, Power will join her in battle.

Once she "transforms," she's fully armored with heavy plating, and the Shield Axe she uses is also a heavy weapon. But thanks to the perfect coordination of the thrusters and magnetic levitation engine, the frame moves very lightly and flexibly, not hindered by the weight.

That crosshair in her eye is actually a highly complex photosensor. Once focused, it's like having a mini-telescope built right into her eye. This lets Nanami observe the stars millions of miles away at any time, or look back at Earth's glow while sailing through distant galaxies...

Due to the cognitive limitations of her communication objects, Ishmael rarely reveals her true form. Instead, she tends to appear in the most acceptable form that matches the surroundings and the other object's information processing mode.

One of her identities in human civilization is Babylonia Control Court higher-up. Though she's documented as a Construct, there are no obvious Inver-Devices on her frame, and her appearance resembles a real human being. Strangely, nobody has questioned about it ever since she took office.
Ishmael rarely focuses on a single moment of time but lays her eyes on the final outcome—why obsess with the details of a fleeting moment if there's no way to change the result?

Ishmael won't interfere with the important nodes of development or deliberately avoid them. She always goes with the mood of the moment. From her perspective, it can lead to more possibilities in the future, and perhaps the answer she's been waiting for is being born quietly at the same time.

Today, emotions like love and courage can hardly evoke Ishmael's feelings. She understands them but can no longer get moved due to time and her detached perspective. Sparks of little things die quickly. Even if they converge into flame, they would be inevitably devoured by the cold universe... But fire is fire. It shines as it burns. So she is eager to see how long the flame of mankind can burn and whether it can cut through the endless darkness or not.

Remnants of a civilization lie behind the Gateway, like remains sealed in amber in the very moment of death and lasting until today without corruption or continuation. Ishmael would occasionally revisit that place. Perhaps there would be moments when she thinks of an old friend called Gray Raven.

A mysterious Ascendant once appeared in the abandoned Las Prados. Most of the information of the Ascendant's frame was lost, but according to the witnesses, its technology and design might have something to do with Babylonia.

Considering Lilith's potential needs to attend various social occasions, the designers specially created parts to conceal the mechanical structures during the initial stage of frame design. Meanwhile, it would be helpful for Lilith to get close to the enemy and assassinate them off guard. However, the plan of these parts was canceled later, and Lilith no longer needed such concealment.

The frame was originally designed for melee battles and battles in narrow spaces. However, during the adaptation phase, Lilith suggested developing a set of portable card-shaped blades based on cardistry cards to overcome the frame's weakness of lack of firepower in open areas.
In addition to cards, Lilith suggested developing many dangerous weapons she called 'magic props' and independently finished the development of some of them.

The designers left many hollow structures to hide weapons and for the frame to be able to move faster. However, to solve the power output issue, they eventually decided to greatly enhance the frame's leg strength instead. The hidden pikes can stick out quickly when necessary, making Lilith able to launch a deadly strike at the target.

Having passed the strength screening, Lilith has also changed her tactical preference and added more magic techniques to the fight, making it harder for her opponent to predict her movement in battle.

Selena, opera singer, WGAA member, and an experienced soldier. She once went missing in a battle at the space station but then saved by an "agent" and started a long journey of retrieving her memories on Earth. At the end of the journey, she found herself again and returned to Babylonia as a new person.

Pianissimo is a "new frame" created based on Capriccio with a series of adjustments. Although the frame was made in a way that is slightly different from that of the specialized frames in the past, this is, for Selena, the plan that suits her habit. Due to the damage she had during her time as Siren, there is still remaining traumatic phantom pain in her M.I.N.D. despite the retrieval of all her memories. Therefore, using Capriccio, the frame that once formed a stable connection to "Whale Song" signals, as the basis can relieve the pain.

Selena is still able to build some kind of special connection to the Punishing Virus. She can "hear" the remaining "sounds" of the Red Tide and use their power to fight. However, entering this state will cause heavy load to M.I.N.D., so Pianissimo will disconnect from the "sounds" and enter the Noise state after a certain period of time. Once healed in the Noise state, the frame will be able to harness the power again.

The powerful computing power of Pianissimo's core enables Selena to play five parts simultaneously even in the fiercest fight. When the suppression device plays a song under the direction of the Bowstring Rapier, it will create overwhelming sound waves that will sweep across the battlefield like a raging storm.

The white floral vine pattern on the frame is a gift from the most important person to Selena. Iris is Selena's favorite flower. In the past, she could only see it in the test tube in the greenhouse. However, during her long journey, she finally got to see them in full blossom on the plain after rain, which, for her, commemorates the fact that the "truth" is finally in her hand.

Selena picked the name "Pianissimo" with Gray Raven Commandant. She wants to use it as a reminder to herself that the hall of art does welcomes everyone and that her cello will always sing for everyone she encounters. The name has followed her around in her long battle and served as the pillar that helped her to stand up again and again in the storm.

The frame's prototype was developed by a researcher. After Jetavie passed the awakening trial, the prototype's internal hardware was iterated by the Matrix, while the external armor was modified according to Jetavie's wishes until it became the recognizable Daybreak today.

Before she arrived in the real world, Jetavie commanded all the computing power of the Matrix but none of its energy. Although Daybreak's charging unit has an extremely high energy density, it still cannot afford the power needed to utilize Jetavie's immense computing power.

Jetavie possesses rich and complex emotions after she is awakened. A lot of real-time processing is required to respond to these signals promptly, so her personality module regularly consumes 60% of her frame's energy.

While its combat capability is extraordinary, Jetavie's frame has a comparatively low battery life. During an intense battle, she would briefly disable some of her personality data to keep her combat module running, but the data could be lost if the battle lasted too long.
Due to the limitations of the energy structure, the frame's computing power is relatively underpowered. Daybreak's performance is far from what Jetavie is capable of.

The prefix of her designation is "Matrix-Awakening-Validation". As the precursor, the Chosen One's designation is 00. Jetavie's designation is 01, and she was also the only individual from Project Matrix who has been validated.

Geiravor was once one of the experimental frames in Kurono's inventory. However, due to various reasons, it failed to pass the batch testing and could only be recycled after being discarded. During that covert operation on the island, Kurono "shared" the data of this frame with Babylonia. Subsequently, Babylonia conducted further modifications and adjustments to the frame, and its performance has now stabilized.

The frame maintained the design philosophy from the early Reconquista Age, with its Inver-Device preserving a rather exaggerated form. Even after being taken over by Babylonia, the distinctive and decorative structure was kept intact to "retain aesthetic harmony in its appearance."
Even in sleep mode, the sentry module installed on the frame stays highly vigilant.

An inconspicuous "plug"-style device is situated at Geiravor's collarbone position. This functions as a "valve" to regulate the frame's release of its maximum combat capabilities. In case of an emergency, removing this restriction allows Geiravor to unleash overwhelming peak superiority.

Scars from past mission executions mark the back of the frame. Usually hidden by Vera's hair, they go unnoticed by many. Yet, following the frame's transfer to Babylonia, Vera purposefully insisted on retaining these "scars." Perhaps it was her way of holding onto something uniquely her own.
The very first Mind Beacon connection between Commandant and Vera was established through this exact frame, despite Commandant's lack of proficiency with the procedure at that time.
Older twin brother of Dante. Same to Dante, he is a half-human and half-demon born from the dark knight Sparda and his human wife, Eva.
A legendary dark knight that masters rapid laido.
Vergil didn't know when or why, but he started to love poetry and philosophy books.
Vergil doesn't like heavy weapons, automatic rifles, or any weapons enhanced by human technology.
Vergil has a son named Nero but he didn't know this until Nero grew up. The two's father-son relationship was revealed during some "final battle."

Yamato is one of the weapons left by Vergil's father, Sparda. It is a Devil Sword that only accepts the chosen one as its master. From the weapon's sharp blade, Vergil found the "absolute power" he looked for and used it to his advantage.
A half-human and half-demon born from Sparda, the demon hero who saved the human world and his human wife, Eva.
The boss of Devil May Cry who also accepts devil hunt missions through specific code phrases as a side job.
The most powerful devil hunter alive. Revered for his legendary strength.

Dante's signature weapons are the longsword named Rebellion left by his father and the handguns designed by the famous gunsmith Nell Goldstein named Ebony & Ivory, but now he's using the greatsword named Devil Sword Dante.
He has overcome multiple difficulties and stopped demons' invasions to the human world.
Dante is a tough guy who always keeps his signature smile in difficult situations. He's strong yet gentle with a sense of justice deep down.

Although the new frame only underwent hasty adaptation before being deployed in high-intensity combat, the combat side effects are almost negligible thanks to the Science Council's human-centered approach. Even the last minor M.I.N.D. fluctuations were resolved through a Deep M.I.N.D. connection with the Gray Raven Commandant.

The frame's surface emits a faint off-white glow, which troubled Bianca for a while as she couldn't find a way to turn it off. It wasn't until she consulted the designer that she learned this was a result of the sunlight absorbed by the crown on her veil.

The designer sheepishly described the frame's glowing feature as "not particularly useful, but it feels like Bianca." After some discussions with her, the designer repurposed the solar energy absorbed by the crown into backup power for the frame, which has proved to be unexpectedly effective in harsh combat environments.

Due to her proficiency with the swordstaff, Bianca initially preferred using her new weapon's sword form. But when the Red Tide cut off her path forward, she instinctively switched the lashblade to its whip form to rescue the trapped commandant from afar. According to Bianca's later recollection, choosing to transform the sword into a whip was "almost pure instinct."

After Asimov "reversed" the original Phantom Tracer, he mounted it externally within "Noctiluca", Bianca's CUB, significantly reducing the burden on Bianca's M.I.N.D. during the process of compressing the Punishing Virus.

While the coating's white exterior raised questions about its practicality for nighttime operations, the electrochromic fibers it uses actually have excellent adaptive camouflage capabilities, reducing reflectivity to below 0.9% at night.

Secator is a new type of Construct created by Babylonia to repair the damaged M.I.N.D. of Discord. Compared to Kurono's old frame which utilized illegal emotional fine-tuning technology, Secator's M.I.N.D. requires more frequent adjustments and stabilization in the early stages, but offers higher adaptability and safety for the pilot.
Magnetic field lines and scissors are Discord's beloved weapons. She can skillfully wield them to restrict enemy movement and cut through the battlefield.
Power output is boosted to maximum with the mask on. Due to the heavy burden on the M.I.N.D., however, it cannot be used for extended periods.
Her experiences have made her more mature than her appearance suggests. Sometimes people find her difficult to approach and talk to because of the mask she often wears.
Her reflexes are exceptional—not only on the battlefield, but also in everyday life when she needs to prevent accidents before they happen, such as cutting off Shiva's jinxes before they are spoken.
Through everyone's collective efforts, she recovered her past and her M.I.N.D. is repaired. In the future, she hopes to do everything in her power to help others mend their lives.
The designers keep testing and upgrading Veronica's frame. In their words, many of its modules are badly worn, and they never expected her to still fight with such power.
Veronica no longer resists connecting her M.I.N.D. with the Commandant. At times she even suggests it herself, to make sure her M.I.N.D. does not deviate when traveling alongside the Commandant.
She is a mechanoid of immense battle strength, usually proud and solitary. But to the Commandant, her heart is not as cold and tough as her frame. Instead, she has become a reliable companion.
When the designers try to create coatings for other occasions, they struggle to adapt the styles to her wings and tail. Later, the Gray Raven Commandant offers an idea, and Veronica accepts it.

Veronica is skilled at using her tail in combat, making her tactics more versatile. In some cases, her tail even serves as part of her weaponry. Because of the frame's unique long-tail design, the designers carefully adjust its overall weight balance.
